review_preview: This was a great find on our trip to Madrid.  The food was fresh and packed with local flavors.  For us it was a long cab ride form our hotel but it was worth it.  When we arrived our host Cesar said we needed to...
review_full: This was a great find on our trip to Madrid. The food was fresh and packed with local flavors. For us it was a long cab ride form our hotel but it was worth it. When we arrived our host Cesar said we needed to share, which we thought meant as a couple we needed to share. No, no...for Cesar it meant we need to order 1/2 portions and taste all the selections family style. If we ordered full portion we could have feed two more couples with our two first and second courses. Our 1/2 portions arrived paced, one after we finished another. Each was fresh and filled with local flavor. We had a salad with cheese shavings, bacon and an aged balsamic vinegar on top. It was so good we neglected to put on oil and vinegar which was provided. We had a soup made from a local vegetable I could not pronounce either the English or Spanish versions. For our entries we had a special Iberia pork cut topped with caramelized onions and brie, and a simple dish of monk fish topped with olive oil, lemon juice, roasted garlic and red pepper bits. Everything was fresh. The best part was it was very affordable. Even with the cab fare it was less than other restaurants we visited of similar quality. When we arrived we were at first concerned because the front was just a bar, and we were lead to a very small restaurant area in the back where no one was seated. We spoke only English and all the staff tried their best to welcome us, which quickly overcame any concerns we had. We arrived at 8:30PM on a Saturday night and there were two tables with guests; by 9:30PM ALL the tables were full !! Alcaravea was filled with very happy local patrons, and one very happy tourist customer. We were lucky we made reservations because we would have missed the wonderful food, and most important the friendly staff and Cesar.

review_preview: I was taken to this restaurant by a local Madrid friend and I can definitely state that it is one of the better restaurants I have been to get n Madrid. I have the menu del dia with a fabada asturiana (Spanish bean stew) as...
review_full: I was taken to this restaurant by a local Madrid friend and I can definitely state that it is one of the better restaurants I have been to get n Madrid. I have the menu del dia with a fabada asturiana (Spanish bean stew) as the first course. Second course a small leg of lamb roasted asturiana style with potato's followed by an excellent dessert. This all comes with wine, bottled water and bread. This to me was an excellent meal. The portions are so big that I am sure you will not be able to eat all of it. And one thing I notice is the place is full of Spanish enjoying their lunches. And also the price is inexpensively low. Of course I do not know that we received such an excellent service is because my companion is,well known to the restaurant. I did returned with my companion 2 days later and the same high standard is bestowed upon us. This time I have a rice with shellfish as a first course and a cocido madrileno and again big portions. I again thoroughly enjoyed the meals. I would rate this place one of my most enjoyable restaurants in Madrid to go to.

review_preview: My wife and I have been to Madrid numerous times and have been to many of the Restaurants listed in the top 100. In my opinion this was easily the best Restaurant we have eaten at here in Madrid.  As most of the previous posters...
review_full: My wife and I have been to Madrid numerous times and have been to many of the Restaurants listed in the top 100. In my opinion this was easily the best Restaurant we have eaten at here in Madrid. As most of the previous posters have mentioned portion sizes are large, don't worry about trying to figure out the menu. Caesar was our waiter Oscar was working some of the other tables as well. Both of them will explain the specials and recommend ordering portions which will still be too much. Louisa assisted in our service and was outstanding. All of the staff speak good English and make ordering very easy. We ordered 2 starters and two 1/2 portion mains which was too much food still. We had four glasses of wine, one expresso and two after dinner shots bill was 60 euro. Great price for value of meal. A couple should consider 2 starters and one 1/2 portion main. That will be a lot of food.  We had burrata mozzarella as one of our starters exceptional. We had two units of the zucchini flowerette with some kind of reduced vinaigrette. It was splendid.  We had a half portion of beef cheek stew which was similar to braised beef rib. Flavor was terrific meat very tender. Meat was served with small shoestring potatoes and reduced veggies from stew, meal came on a plate. The other main we had was a pork steak cut into small strips which they recommended be cooked on the rare side. Pork was buttery dish was served with piquillo peppers shoestring potatoes with rosemary on top of peppers.  Wine was Tempranillo was very smooth. We could not eat dessert but saw two things come out they looked awesome and we will save room next time for sure.

review_preview: We stopped in here on 3 different nights during our trip to Madrid.  The first night we were just looking for a place to have drinks and wanted a something that looked lively and fun - and it was!  If you sit at the bar,...
review_full: We stopped in here on 3 different nights during our trip to Madrid. The first night we were just looking for a place to have drinks and wanted a something that looked lively and fun - and it was! If you sit at the bar, you'll be given some sort complimentary tapas with your drink (a tradition practiced in most of the bars in this neighborhood, but no longer common in other places in Spain). Prices were cheap, especially for Madrid. Everything that we ate was good, and we always left satisfied.  However, it is the friendliness of the staff that really sets this place apart. On our 2nd visit, not only did the servers recognize us, but they greeted us by name. By the 3rd visit, it was hugs and kisses as if old friends. This is what makes people come back, and it worked for us. We will definitely make a point to visit here again on future trips!

title_review: Lip smacking fare in the heart of Madrid
review_preview: Most of my Madrid restaurant reviews are going to be of places we chanced upon while looking for good food. Chicken/pollo in particular since we do not eat pork or beef. While reading the menu displayed outside Cantina a warm looking man popped out of...
review_full: Most of my Madrid restaurant reviews are going to be of places we chanced upon while looking for good food. Chicken/pollo in particular since we do not eat pork or beef.  While reading the menu displayed outside Cantina a warm looking man popped out of the window stating that he serves the best paella around. We decided to take a chance and trust me it was worth it.  The restaurant, spic and span, has great service. They guided us well with the menu.  We ordered anchovies fritas (fried fish), garlic chicken and chicken paella. Bread (pan) was served complimentary. With all this, a glass of red wine and 3 nesteas we paid €66.  Tip: in most restaurants across Spain, the price mentioned for paella is for one person and it is mandatory you order for a minimum of two. Like at this place we had to pay €30 for paella for two people while the menu suggested €15.

review_preview: Located just across from fabled Sobrino Botin restaurant, which we also liked very much, we ate twice at, and really liked, Cantina La Traviesa.  First, the waiters here are true professionals ... most friendly and knowledgeable.  Coming and going, they were extremely and genuinely welcoming....
review_full: Located just across from fabled Sobrino Botin restaurant, which we also liked very much, we ate twice at, and really liked, Cantina La Traviesa. First, the waiters here are true professionals ... most friendly and knowledgeable. Coming and going, they were extremely and genuinely welcoming. The food here is very reasonably priced, and the sangria tasty and honest. The paella is the best we encountered. The facility is very clean, inside and out. As others have mentioned, it does not have a touristy feel, with many local regulars in evidence. Varied menu; nice tapas selection. Recommend most highly.

review_preview: This place is a gem.  In a non-descript suburb of the city and nothing to look at from the outside, but the food was great.  We got there early, before they were actually officially open, but they welcomed us and gave us beers and tapas....
review_full: This place is a gem. In a non-descript suburb of the city and nothing to look at from the outside, but the food was great. We got there early, before they were actually officially open, but they welcomed us and gave us beers and tapas. We are not talking about the basic cheap stuff you get in bars - this was cooked in their kitchen, and the servings huge. We had to hold back from eating more as we didn't want to spoil our lunch! The highlight of the meal was the pork shoulder. Cooked to perfection, flavoursome, and a generous serving. Cesar the owner was helpful with advice on the menu, warning us not to over-order. We had a beautiful local organic red wine with the meal, and although we asked for a light wine, it was 15%! My wife liked the Russian Salad from the tapas so much she had more with her meal, and they had no problem serving that to her at no extra charge. The restaurant and service has a homely down to earth feel to it, and this allied to the great food meant that the place was packed after a very short time. We were the only tourists as far as we could see, and Cesar was interested to know how we found out about the place. When we said it was TA he said he was really embarrassed by the restaurant's very high rating, as he sees himself as a down to earth guy running a small local restaurant that is nothing that special, and the international exposure makes him a little uneasy as it might raise expectations unduly. He has nothing to worry about...the service was great and friendly, the food excellent, and the prices very reasonable. If you are ever in Madrid, it is well worth a visit.

Starting for the service is absolutely perfect, it means dont bother you but they always are when you need it without asking for. Dont need formal clothes, is casual, the atmosphere is friendly and you can ask in every moment whatever you want. The food is the best I have tried. Very elaborated cuisine but you know what are you eating ever and the portions are huge not minimal at all. Cellar with thousands of references, wines worldwide. Sincerely the best in Madrid, I use to go every month because I live 400 km far. And belive me, money value guaranteed.

review_preview: This top rated restaurant wasn't on my overworked list of places we've already been, so I booked it with a half hour to spare on a Thursday night.It's in a beautiful neighborhood, "Geronimos", next to the Retiro, on a quiet street.  We booked for...
review_full: This top rated restaurant wasn't on my overworked list of places we've already been, so I booked it with a half hour to spare on a Thursday night. It's in a beautiful neighborhood, "Geronimos", next to the Retiro, on a quiet street. We booked for 8:30 PM and we were the first people there. Eventually, the place filled up, so remember, Spaniards don't eat early. The chef comes out to explain the menus--if you're a Spanish Speaker. If you speak English, then your waiter gets the job. The chef is funny and engaging--if you understand what he's saying. The menus is all about the entrees. That's kind of weird. The chef explained the salads and appetizers--they're not on the menu. When we first sat down, we were contemplating how we were going to spend 35 Euros for both an entree sized appetizer and an equally priced entree. The chef's visit cleared up the confusion. We split a special salad with Serrano ham and fresh cheese. My wife had Iberico pork loin and I had squab for dinner. We split a gorgeous coconut panna cotta for dessert. Dinner came to 180 euros, but bear in ind that I ordered a 60 euro bottle of wine and we had two glasses of Albarino to start off the meal. So, while this wasn't cheap, it wasn't abusive either. We both loved the dinner, the service and the ambiance. We're coming back with family.

title_review: Classic with a Twist of Majic
review_preview: Viridiana offers a classic Spanish cuisine. Yet, if you have not come to Viridiana, you are probably missing majic. Traditional dishes taken to a higher level through the hands of Chef Abraham García. Like the classic callos a la madrileña con rape (monkfish). Or a...
review_full: Viridiana offers a classic Spanish cuisine. Yet, if you have not come to Viridiana, you are probably missing majic. Traditional dishes taken to a higher level through the hands of Chef Abraham García. Like the classic callos a la madrileña con rape (monkfish). Or a traditional lentil soup with coconut, curry or ginger and spices. Or a superb pigeon. All of this paired with an outstanding yet affordable selection of wines. Settled in the beat neigh orhood of town, El Retiro. Viridiana ia a worth visiting worth repeating experience.

review_preview: We initially chose this restaurant primarily for its proximity to our hotel but ended up eating there three times.We expected and got Spanish cooking at its best. Highlights were the roast squab which had been substituted for the poulet de bresse that evening and...
review_full: We initially chose this restaurant primarily for its proximity to our hotel but ended up eating there three times. We expected and got Spanish cooking at its best. Highlights were the roast squab which had been substituted for the poulet de bresse that evening and the grilled shrimp with ajoblanco. Given confidence by the quality of the materials, on the second visit I chose the “presa iberica” which turned out to be a seared pinkish fillet of sucking pig. One does not eat pink pork but I risked it; it was delicious and I am still in good health!  On the third visit we were entertaining guests including one from Thailand. And then came the unexpected. Among the ‘specials’ was a ‘sashimi ceviche’ – or that’s what I think the waiter said – which was acclaimed as brilliant by my guest. Not what you expect from a small local restaurant in Spain!   The Viridiana is idiosyncratic. The starters on the menu tend to be as large portions as the mains and priced accordingly. But the real starters, as well as several mains, are specials of the day described verbally and including for example two salads and some delicious croquettes of guinea fowl and ham. Extra unordered plates appear without warning or apparent charge, most notably lentil soup served with a prawn on one occasion and a meatball on another.  Service is charming and the large and ebullient chef/patron very present to supervise at least one of his family. However on the evening with guests our conversation was never interrupted unnecessarily by the staff as it so often is elsewhere. English was somewhat limited but on two of the evenings helped by a bilingual Filipino.   The whole atmosphere is full of enthusiasm and dedication to the imaginative use of the best raw materials they can source. It is also great fun.

title_review: THE MOST ROMANTIC RESTAURANT IN MADRID
review_preview: This restaurant oozes with romance.  It's the perfect place to take your significant other, whether it's a first time or whenever.  You could say it's also magical from the first time you see it.  We've never seen a restaurant so thematically designed for romance and...
review_full: This restaurant oozes with romance. It's the perfect place to take your significant other, whether it's a first time or whenever. You could say it's also magical from the first time you see it. We've never seen a restaurant so thematically designed for romance and a homage to film, specifically Luis Bunuel, a very famous film director.  It's location is in a very charming neighborhood where you can walk before or after dining. It's located in a neighborhood right on the edge of Retiro Park. Your first impression from the street and sidewalk already hints at the romanticism you are about to experience. One can be seated outside or inside. Inside, there are several levels, and we had a table on the street level, near the front windows. Everything from the seating, table setting, wall decor, chairs encapsulates the restaurant theme. I have to say that we've never seen anything quite like it (that's a compliment).  Once we absorbed all the ambience, we settled down and ordered off the menu. We were presently surprised that (like others) we were given a complimentary appetizer to start (stuffed mushroom). Of course, we had some champagne to start. Then, we shared a side of croquettes. This was not very appetizing, being for us either too mushy and very little taste. Not too mention, the order was just too much.  The main entrees were much better. My wife had the "salad of 1000 vegetables". Well, there were not 1000, but everything was very fresh and tasty. She also had the grilled hake which was also excellent. I had a very nice order of sweet rice with the famous Iberico ham (arroz meloso con jamon Iberico). The dessert was also excellent, a cream vanilla burned with vanilla and fresh berries on top. If you're looking for a romantic restaurant with good food, this is the place!

review_preview: We went to this restaurant with my wife to celebrate my birthday and our wedding anniversary.It was recommended by the receptionist at our hotel.First of all I need to say that I can not fault the food!!!! The food was delicious, the desserts where...
review_full: We went to this restaurant with my wife to celebrate my birthday and our wedding anniversary.It was recommended by the receptionist at our hotel. First of all I need to say that I can not fault the food!!!! The food was delicious, the desserts where not to my liking but that does not mean that they were not good. Just not the taste that I prefer. The service was excellent and all the waiters were very polite and professional. I wish I could do a separate review for the Chef/owner, and give a good review to everything else. We knew that the chef was going out to welcome the clients and explain the menu. We saw him going to every table and do so,and when it was our turn,he came to our table,and when we said ''Hi Chef '' instead of Hola...he took this face of contempt,moved his hand in a not very polite way and said ''English?? My colleague speaks...'' That was it. He went to every table 2-3 times, and every time he passed by ours, he avoided eye contact. Two of the waiters were speaking decent English.He could have somebody to translate 2 words as a welcome.Even just a smile would be enough for a couple that paid 145 Euros in his restaurant. Instead, we felt like we had the plague or something.... The receptionist back at the hotel said,Don't mind him, he is ''special''.Well,I believe the clients that pay him and honor him every day are special. The restaurant works for the clients,if not...any chef can stay at home and cook for himself.  Again I say though, that the food was very good.My wife had a fantastic tuna and I had the Galician cow with black truffle. I recommend it for the food.Especially if you speak Spanish, you have nothing to be afraid off :))))

Other Spanish restaurants we visited were far more hospitable. Hard to put your finger on it, but this place was a little too cold, and very expensive. Still, very high quality. They took good care of us (two women travelling as work colleagues). I just did not feel at home. Sometimes, it's just that "je ne sais pas" (sorry I don't have the Spanish version, alas).

review_preview: We were recommended the Viridiana by our hotel and it was an outstanding restaurant in Madrid, probably the best meal I have ever had in the city. Dining here is an experience of excellent, well prepared food, with quality service and passion by the friendly...
review_full: We were recommended the Viridiana by our hotel and it was an outstanding restaurant in Madrid, probably the best meal I have ever had in the city. Dining here is an experience of excellent, well prepared food, with quality service and passion by the friendly chef Abraham García. He came over to speak to us and took a few photos. It is always good to have dinner at a place where the owner/chef is very active.  There are starters that are served with your mains, so from the olives and breads, all the way to the final desserts, you will enjoy every aspect of your meal. We had the pulpo and tuna and both main were expertly prepared and delicious.  There are two rooms in the restaurant. We sat upstairs which I think gives a better feel for the restaurant but both are really nice.  I highly recommend Viridiana I will return again and again.

The restaurant was full, but the service was incompetent and they never managed to bring all the main courses at the same time. Had I paid institutional prices for this, I would have been happy,but at around 30euros for a main course, it was hugely disappointing. This is a long established restaurant that has become complacent and needs to improve standards.

review_preview: We knew we were in for a wonderful experience, when the taxi driver pulled up to the Restaurant and waxed poetic about the food and the exceptional chef, a source of Madrid pride. It was our finest restaurant meal on a 21/2 month trip. The...
review_full: We knew we were in for a wonderful experience, when the taxi driver pulled up to the Restaurant and waxed poetic about the food and the exceptional chef, a source of Madrid pride. It was our finest restaurant meal on a 21/2 month trip. The chef/ owner had an eagle eye over the 2 story, beautifully decorated restaurant. These days, it is hard to find the perfect blend of gourmet food, with extras from the kitchen, local products and preparations, friendly service and fine wines. We sat in the upper level, wonderfully decorated with tables far apart that you have the feeling of privacy. The menu has intricate preparations and we appreciated our waitress who helped us interpret the menu. You can’t go wrong - it’s just deciding that is difficult. We started with a squash soup - a gift from the kitchen - followed by herring that was incredibly tender and came with shots of vodka ( a real treat and hard to find in this region) - we then had roast suckling pig with side dishes - the portion was large and we were happy that we had decided to share it. Too full for dessert , we ordered coffee but another gift from the kitchen of sorbet came- chocolates with the coffee and another gift of after dinner liqueur. It was truly exceptional . The wine was perfect as well. If you are lucky enough to be in Madrid, it is one of those places you don’t want to miss.

As a result I ordered the french fries covered in fried eggs and Spanish ham. I thought it was great. The greasy hangover food was just what I needed. My wife ordered some croquets or something that was fried. She ate it all so I would assume she liked it as well. I didn’t pay much attention to her food on this trip as I do on others. I guess I just was focused on relaxing this trip. Food in Madrid is not the best, so a quality place was a good find for us.

All were delicious.

My husband tried the shark and I had the fillet (which was a little fatty for my taste, and I think medium-well got lost in translation as it showed up medium-rare). We had the chorizo and the cheese tapas which were very good, and a beer and Sangria (also delicious), all for under 30 Euros. The restaurant was also in a very lively area with lots of other nightlife nearby. We thought it was good value for money, and the friendly service and lively atmosphere made for a fun evening out in Madrid.

title_review: Good Italian in Salamanca area of Madrid
review_preview: My daughter and I just ate here a few days ago for dinner. We had excellent customer service, from start to finish. We made a reservation, and the restaurant saved us a lovely spot by the window, with good views. We were given a complimentary...
review_full: My daughter and I just ate here a few days ago for dinner. We had excellent customer service, from start to finish. We made a reservation, and the restaurant saved us a lovely spot by the window, with good views. We were given a complimentary appetizer of freshly sliced mortadella, with a specially prepared sauce, very good. Then we were given a complimentary glass of Prosecco, also very good. We ordered a starter--mussels in tomato sauce, very good, and two pasta dishes--both were also very good, especially my tagliatelle with bolognese sauce. We ordered two desserts, also very good (especially the tiramisu). We were then given a glass of limoncello on the house. All together, very good. Cost was 84 euros. We will definitely come here again next time we are in Madrid.

title_review: one of the best dining experiences in Madrid or anywhere else!
review_preview: This is a truly extraordinary restaurant, led by a marvelous chef who creates the most memorable dishes with creativity and elegance that are so indicative of the cusine and culture of a great country like Spain.  One of my favorite dining experiences in Madrid -...
review_full: This is a truly extraordinary restaurant, led by a marvelous chef who creates the most memorable dishes with creativity and elegance that are so indicative of the cusine and culture of a great country like Spain. One of my favorite dining experiences in Madrid - everything we had , from the amuse bouche to the coffee and truffles were outstanding and perfect in every way. Also, the Bellinis are the best anywhere! The chef is gracious enough to come and welcome each guest and explain the menu and the specials. A real pleasure to dine in an establishment like this which is full of the great Spanish tradition of taking food seriously. At the same time, I would like to address some of the critisim in previous reviews, especially from English -speaking visitors. Yes, the bread and oil are not free and are part of the cover charge, which is practiced in most restaurants in Spain. It is not 5 eur per person but 2.50 per person and the bread and oil are of the highest quality, one which is rare to find in the US. Also, there is a special house bread, created by the chef, which is served to all the clients and its a wonderfully delicious treat along with several amuse bouches which are not part of the menu but which are served to every customer for free. And while bottled water is expensive everywhere in the world (a bottle of Evian can easily run you $8-10 in NY), the wine is incredibly reasonable in Spain. Also, nobody adds a 20% tip charge to your bill since service is not included in Spain and is left at your own discretion. Finally, the chef and owner does not speak English but since when did that become a requirement for great chefs? When you come to Per Se in NY, does Thomas Keller come out and explain each dish to every international customer in his or her own native language? Viridiana is an expensive restaurant - that is true - but the quality of the ingredients, the product and the preparation are exceptional and merit the price. I cannot recommend this restaurant enough to anyone visiting Madrid, who would like to have a truly memorable experience and who appreciates fine cuisine prepared by a great talent like Mr. Garcia.

title_review: Upmarket designer restaurant, very expensive with food below par
review_preview: Located in the posh area of Madrid near the Retiro Park, Prado museum and designer boutiques it has a pleasant modern decor, eye-watering prices to match the surrounding establishments and unaccomplished food. Only one of the waiters spoke some broken English and although the service...
review_full: Located in the posh area of Madrid near the Retiro Park, Prado museum and designer boutiques it has a pleasant modern decor, eye-watering prices to match the surrounding establishments and unaccomplished food. Only one of the waiters spoke some broken English and although the service tried hard, though amateurish, it could not compensate for food that was mostly bland and forgettable. Starters were passable but as we progressed, the ensuing courses became increasingly unimaginative and plainly a failure. Wine prices were reasonable though. Best avoided.

title_review: Excellent food in a quirky setting
review_preview: We enjoyed an excellent meal and attentive service in this characterful restaurant. While the staff had limited Englis,h we were made very welcome and managed to communicate effectively using our limited Spanish. The chef/patron explained the days special dishes, one of which was chosen to...
review_full: We enjoyed an excellent meal and attentive service in this characterful restaurant. While the staff had limited Englis,h we were made very welcome and managed to communicate effectively using our limited Spanish. The chef/patron explained the days special dishes, one of which was chosen to good effect. Other reviewers’ comments are difficult to understand. This is a top end boutique restaurant for people who like good food and can afford to pay for it. It is aimed at a local Madrilieno clientele and not at tourists. There is no reason why they should be able to speak English, when that is not their intended market. Cover charges are commonplace throughout Europe, one is not just paying for bread! In a city with some fairly indifferent, albeit expensive restaurants, this is well worth a visit.

title_review: Good Spainish Food, Great staff, in the heart of the action!
review_preview: We had dinner here last night and it was delectable.  The restaurant is just a five minute walk from the Neptune Fountain, through a quiet residental area away from the bussel of Major Palazza. I ordered quesadillas with beef in mole sauce as a starter...
review_full: We had dinner here last night and it was delectable. The restaurant is just a five minute walk from the Neptune Fountain, through a quiet residental area away from the bussel of Major Palazza. I ordered quesadillas with beef in mole sauce as a starter and the pork tenderloin stuffed with cheese and ancient raisins. Our meal commenced with an amuse bouche of cream of parsnip soup with jambon, followed by another amuse bouche of herring with a papaya salsa. This was almost enough to satisfy me. The quesadilla was nice and crisp with a rich mole sauce. The pork loin arrived stuffed with melting cheese and cut in half resting inside a ribbon of pastry on top of barley with vegetables. Absolutely fabulous.

review_full: Did I stumble into a gem tonight. Seriously, one of the best meals I've had in a lifetime. Around the block from my hotel. Little place seats about 20.  First, the standard little Spanish olives. And really good bread. Expected. No biggie. But then, a complimentary cream of radish with goat cheese, served in a copper pot.  Then, duck foie gras that was to die for.  Then, a mushroom risotto, cooked to absolute perfection...and Chef Abraham Garcia (Boca) came out with a basket of white truffles (the Madonna of truffles) and proceeded to grate an entire whole one over my dish.  Pair that with a stellar French Sancerre.  I'll sleep well tonight...and extra minutes on the hotel's elliptical in the morning.

review_preview: I visited this restaurant on Tuesday evening, persuaded (foolish me) by the positive reviews on TA.  We arrived about 820, early by Madrid standards, so the restaurant was more or less empty and we were seated immediately.  The waiter advised us that the kitchen didn't...
review_full: I visited this restaurant on Tuesday evening, persuaded (foolish me) by the positive reviews on TA. We arrived about 820, early by Madrid standards, so the restaurant was more or less empty and we were seated immediately. The waiter advised us that the kitchen didn't open until 830 so there would be no hot food before that point Some mortadella-style meat with a mustardy sauce was placed on the table but no bread/ breadsticks (although we were charged a cover charge for both) and eventually someone took our drinks and food order. Two of us ordered glasses of Moet rose - the waiter came back with a bottle of rose wine, I clarified we are after the champagne, so off he headed again to look for it. The starters arrived with still no evidence of the champagne and the waiter finally turned up to say they had none in stock and that an Italian sparkling would be just as nice - we accepted and it then took another five minutes before that turned up. The menu is very long with three categories of pasta in lots of different shapes and plenty of pizza choices. One of us had penne arrabbiata which looked and tasted as if it had come out of a supermarket jar, while my seafood linguine could best be described as industrial. At no point did any of the staff come back to refill our water glasses (the bottle was not left on the table and we did not see it again) nor ask if we wanted more drinks but given how long it took the first lot to arrive, that may have been a blessing. To add insult to injury, i had to ask for the bill FOUR times before we could beat a hasty retreat. FYI the cost was 100 euros for two bruschette, one caprese salad, one caesar salad, the two bowls of pasta, three glasses of wine and a bottle of water - so while not expensive, it was not cheap either.

title_review: Left a bad taste in my mouth
review_preview: So I have mixed reviews about this place.  First, the prices are strange. Entrees are all in the 30 something euro range, but the apps are about the same price as the entrees, which seems high.  And the portions are appetizer size in case you...
review_full: So I have mixed reviews about this place. First, the prices are strange. Entrees are all in the 30 something euro range, but the apps are about the same price as the entrees, which seems high. And the portions are appetizer size in case you thought they might be large. So instead of paying 25-30 euros for each starter, I asked the waiter if he could just make me a plain green salad with tomatoes. I just wanted some greens with my main dish, since it was all meat and carbs. He said no problem, and also picked a nice red wine for us. Like other reviewers mentioned, they bring you a couple "complimentary" starters, which consisted of a strawberry gazpacho and a plate of antipasti. All in all I was pretty happy with the food (we ordered the bulltail and guinea fowl). When the check came, there were a few shockers. He charged us 25 euros for 1 salad (which is outrageous since it was iceberg lettuce and a few cherry tomatoes), 5 euros for a bottle of water, and 5 euros per person for bread (we each had 1 roll!). At least he didn't choose a ridiculously expensive bottle of wine. In retrospect, I should have complained, but I felt guilty after the free starters (although everyone gets that). After some time to think about the experience, I feel cheated. The restaurant still found a way to get paid for those free starters by charging exorbitant amounts for all those trivial things that you would never expect to cost much. Thus, the bad taste in my mouth. We ended up spending 140 euros for 1 salad, 2 entrees, and 1 bottle of wine.

review_preview: My wife and two teenaged daughters spent a delightful evening at Viridiana in March, 2010.  All in all it was a wonderful experience.   The restaurant is on a quiet back street just off the Paseo de Prado right near the Ritz Hotel.    The restaurant is...
review_full: My wife and two teenaged daughters spent a delightful evening at Viridiana in March, 2010. All in all it was a wonderful experience. The restaurant is on a quiet back street just off the Paseo de Prado right near the Ritz Hotel. The restaurant is very small, cozy and welcoming. The staff were all extremely friendly and knowledgeable. The wine list was quite extensive and quite reasonably priced. The chef spent a great deal of time talking with our daughters both of whom speak Spanish fluently. We let him guide our menu choices, and we were not at all disappointed. While we each ordered separate first and second courses, we were all treated to a starter course of a curried crab soup, and a wonderful salad of various fruits and vegetables. Fortunately, the weather was good enough that we were able to walk back to our hotel after the meal, and work off at least a few of the calories. All in all, a wonderful experience.

title_review: One of the best meals I’ve ever had!
review_preview: This is a very nice small restaurant, where you are personally served by the renowned Chef and owner Abraham Garcia. He is really good! Here you will have a gourmet experience and live any food lovers’ dream.  I went over the long menu (120€) instead...
review_full: This is a very nice small restaurant, where you are personally served by the renowned Chef and owner Abraham Garcia. He is really good! Here you will have a gourmet experience and live any food lovers’ dream.  I went over the long menu (120€) instead a la carte, this is highly recommendable as you get a 5 course dinner plus dessert, and you taste different types of great wines depending on the dish you get. Abraham works with you the different options either on the menu or the house specials based on the season or daily catch, he explains you the details so you can choose the very best. The Foie Gras was superb, the salad amazing, the Oaxacan quesadillas, the cold raspberry soup incredible, a special kind of fish (can’t remember the name) with couscous and potatoes, and for the “grand finale” one of the best desserts I’ve had, the dark chocolate soufflé on banana leaves. It was a shame I was full already, as I could have repeated the dessert many times! And you not only get to pamper your taste, you also get your share on the sight, as all dishes a very nicely served, it’s a shame to eat them (just kidding!)  This is a really special place with a very high standard for quality and service; really impeccable! No wonder why it’s ranked as the 3rd best restaurant in Madrid (out of 2620!)

title_review: Very good food, surprisingly good service, nice memory
review_preview: Having booked reservation a week in advance via email, was very suprised and happy to get a response (since this was the only restaurant that responded to my emails before we left).  Creativity in meals was excellent.  Started with the fried egg app which was...
review_full: Having booked reservation a week in advance via email, was very suprised and happy to get a response (since this was the only restaurant that responded to my emails before we left). Creativity in meals was excellent. Started with the fried egg app which was just amazing. Everyone should experience that. Wife got the cod, which was ok but didn't match in comparison. For entres, I asked to the marrow, which wasn't on the menu but I had read about - they understood my poor spanish and made an amazing marrow dish that put marrow I've had elsewhere to shame. Was really great. Wife got a special truffle paella that again just didn't meet our expectations.  All in all, our 2nd best meal in Madrid......we liked sitting upstairs but downstairs is more cozy....service was excellent....price was a little over expected on the starters but the entres were fairly priced.

review_preview: If you're tired of the Spanish restaurant experience and are looking for something more French mixed with Spanish flavor, and an eccentric setting to top it off, then this is the place for you! Small space with a downstairs cellar atmosphere, you may want to...
review_full: If you're tired of the Spanish restaurant experience and are looking for something more French mixed with Spanish flavor, and an eccentric setting to top it off, then this is the place for you! Small space with a downstairs cellar atmosphere, you may want to request a table on the street level for the natural light. There are no appetizers on the menu because they bring them for you in two separate courses, i.e. more formal dining experience. The duck foie gras is a must, truly memorable! The service is good though not particularly outstanding or friendly, the decor is centered around film and actors, with the restaurants signature plates in the shape of a men's 1940's hat.

review_preview: I stopped here after a day at the museums. I was eating by myself. I got a table in the corner and studied the menu. The chef happened to come out of the kitchen and he saw me sitting by myself while the other tables...
review_full: I stopped here after a day at the museums. I was eating by myself. I got a table in the corner and studied the menu. The chef happened to come out of the kitchen and he saw me sitting by myself while the other tables were full of patrons chatting with their companions. I asked for help choosing a dish and he asked me what I liked. I told him I'll eat anything. He nodded, took the menu away and what happened after was magical. He created a custom tasting menu for me of 6 courses. The foie gras as part of the first course was excellent --- high grade foie gras. Be careful of "foie" in Spain, sometimes it's really just cheap pate but this is excellent foie. I also loved the wild mushroom risotto with sweet breads. The rice was of perfect consistency and full of flavor with the sweet breads adding a nice richness and flavor. I also loved the sword fish cooked in some kind of herbal leaf -- warm and slightly crispy on the outside but sashimi style on the inside. And let's not forget the boar and venison with rosemary infused lentils. This was truly a delightful meal. And the chef charged me such a reasonable price. Thank you. What a way to finish my trip in Spain.

review_full: We stayed in Madrid for a week last year and just had to go back to Venta el Buscon a second time before leaving. The food and ambiance was amazing, the sangria was delicious. It is located in a very happening part of Madrid, but still has the local feel to it (it is not tourist trappy at all). Inside the restaurant is quite loud and hectic, and service isnt bad and the waiters are friendly but they are a little all over the place. But other than that we enjoyed the experience very much, and even returned a second time before leaving madrid. The parillada was amazing, chorizo and papas al ailoli as well, overall great place and very affordable!

title_review: Non-Spanish are not welcome here & all are overcharged
review_preview: If you are not a native of Spain, you should avoid this restaurant, because the chef and staff clearly don't like people who don't speak fluent Spanish and perhaps dislike all tourists. During our two-hour dinner, the chef frequently mingled with his Spanish guests -...
review_full: If you are not a native of Spain, you should avoid this restaurant, because the chef and staff clearly don't like people who don't speak fluent Spanish and perhaps dislike all tourists. During our two-hour dinner, the chef frequently mingled with his Spanish guests - while pointedly ignoring our table. He did serve the risotto personally - as he did for all who ordered it - but he never spoke to us again, while he chatted amiably with all other tables. We do not expect everyone to speak English, but everyone else we've met in Spain has been willing to communicate with us using their limited English and our even more limited Spanish. On top of the lack of courtesy and respect for their guests, Viridiana also follows the practice we've encountered at nearly all restaurants in Spain: They bring bread to your table, whether you ask for it or not, then they add a hefty charge to your bill. Here, where you would expect more elegant service and not to be squeezed for every last Euro, they charge a whopping €5 *per person* for one piece of bread each! The water also is €5. The restaurant also is not smoke-free, and just one smoker is enough to fill the tiny dining room with smoke - not what you want when paying €200+ for two people without dessert. The two couses and two amuses were very good, I must say, but the insulting treatment and overcharges (and smoke) left a very bad taste in our mouths.

review_preview: I was recommeded this restaurant by a Spanish friend of mine, who hadn't been, but was desperate to go...I can see why, this really is an excellent place to eat.Despite turning up 20 minutes too early, the waitress made us feel very welcome and...
review_full: I was recommeded this restaurant by a Spanish friend of mine, who hadn't been, but was desperate to go...I can see why, this really is an excellent place to eat. Despite turning up 20 minutes too early, the waitress made us feel very welcome and ffered us drinks until the kitchen was ready. We took the set menu, with wine (although, this seemed to come automatically, but i'm not sure), which was around 9 courses. Every course was a winner, and the only real complaint was that the portions were actually a bit large, so by the end we were struggling! There are one or two minor details that separate this restaurant from being of Michelin Star quality - for example, on a few occasions if I had finished before my partner or vice versa, they took one plate and waited until the other finished then before taking their plate - it would be far classier and less stressed if they waited until both diners had finished before taking both plates simultaneously - but this is a small gripe, especially when set in the context of a fantastic meal. 5 stars, recommended. All in, including wine for us both, it was only EUR 100 per head, a real bargain.

title_review: Innovative.  Foodies will not be disappointed.
review_preview: We booked a dinner at Viridiana based on Abraham Garcia's fine reputation.  The meal began with two quite substantial amuses-bouches:  A lovely soup, followed by a rather large salad of fruit, vegetables and iberian ham.  For our main course, I had the lamb shank with...
review_full: We booked a dinner at Viridiana based on Abraham Garcia's fine reputation. The meal began with two quite substantial amuses-bouches: A lovely soup, followed by a rather large salad of fruit, vegetables and iberian ham. For our main course, I had the lamb shank with red curry and coconut thai rice. My husband ordered the special risotto with white truffles---Chef Garcia personally grated a pretty generous amount of truffle on the rice---enough that we were a little nervous about the price but it was only 30 euros which is very reasonable, considering the amuse-bouches. The restaurant itself is unpretentious and comfortable. It was an excellent dinner. Everything delicious and beautifully presented.

title_review: If you are a food lover this is heaven !
review_preview: Me and my wife had a week end in Madrid, beside museums there are very  few options like shopping or sightseeing because Madrid is now a big construction site, so we decided to rise the bar of dinners. Viridiana was the first one and was...
review_full: Me and my wife had a week end in Madrid, beside museums there are very few options like shopping or sightseeing because Madrid is now a big construction site, so we decided to rise the bar of dinners. Viridiana was the first one and was an unbeatable experience. Great service, delicious food presented by the Chef Owner Abraham that will also explain some specials. The food is mostly Mediterranean with Spanish influence. 2 Floors ( we eat on the main level) a cozy atmosphere an excellent wine list will complete your evening. On a Friday evening was fully booked, so reservations are mandatory. Be prepared to pay 75 - 80 € for the food, wine fits almost every budget.

title_review: One of the best meals we've ever had.
review_preview: VIRIDIANA came doubly recommended to us for our month-long stay in Madrid from NYC--from a Travel and Leisure blurb, and also from our favorite waiter at one of our favorite places in Madrid, Tasquita de Enfrente.  Both rec were right.  The food is superb.  We...
review_full: VIRIDIANA came doubly recommended to us for our month-long stay in Madrid from NYC--from a Travel and Leisure blurb, and also from our favorite waiter at one of our favorite places in Madrid, Tasquita de Enfrente. Both rec were right. The food is superb. We tried their signature eggs-in-mushroom-mousse-with-truffle as well as a hake entree and a meatballs with peas and rice special del dia. All just wonderful . . . on top of the unexpected complimentary artichoke soup appetizer and composed salad appetizer. A perfectly paired bottle of Godello at a modest 35E held up against all the courses. The space is lovely and elegant without being pissy, quiet without being dead, the service spot-on, the shavings of truffle profuse by Manhattan standards. Just lovely in every way. One of the best meals we've ever had.

review_preview: Started with not one but two complementary appetizers. First and excellent soup served in a small copper pot, chick peas with greens in a meaty broth. Excellent. Then cured beef very thinly sliced with melon, pickled onions and endive. Had we known we were getting...
review_full: Started with not one but two complementary appetizers. First and excellent soup served in a small copper pot, chick peas with greens in a meaty broth. Excellent. Then cured beef very thinly sliced with melon, pickled onions and endive. Had we known we were getting these we might not have ordered an appetizer but it too was outstanding. We shared the lamb sweetbreads in risotto. Even shared it was awfully large. but excellent. I had a deer and boar loin with a delicious sauce with gnocchi, chestnuts and red cabbage (best red cabbage I have ever had) My wife had wood pigeon stuffed pasta with béchamel sauce. Everything was delicious, the price was reasonable for the quality and had a nicely priced Priorat. Plus great people watching. Two tables of men who were a good 20-25 years older if not more than their dates and an older couple across from the two tables with the woman scowling at the mismatched pairs!

title_review: Fun people and the food is Bueno
review_preview: My wife found this place after it was recommended by our hotel staff.  He said, for Tapas, salads and drink go to Venta El Buscon.  We went here and enjoyed the people and the food.  The Tapas are small, but are meant to entice your...
review_full: My wife found this place after it was recommended by our hotel staff. He said, for Tapas, salads and drink go to Venta El Buscon. We went here and enjoyed the people and the food. The Tapas are small, but are meant to entice your appetite for dish of more food. There is a beef sample plate and a seafood sample plate. Nether is meant for one person, ensure you have at least two to four hungry friends to help. The beef plate is delicious. We had it twice. I highly recommend the steak. It is very good. The cook puts on a sea salt that is noticeable and tasty. Also, you are in Spain, have the Sangria. Don't waste time with glasses, get the pitcher, you will want more. On our way out, the servers: Sebastian, Andres and a guy named one day Tierno, another day Ignacio and then tomorrow Juan-Pablo asked us to have a aperitif he called Ba-cha-ran. How can you say no? You can't and should not. It is very good way to top off your evening. This is a lively place with good, food and for good company; you will have fun.

We didn't expect that the day had brought us many great things.  Great things we loved were, amazing warm waitresses & beautiful authentic Spain drawings fully the whole wall. "This is Spain!" We said to each other (my hubby & I) XD .... "ok let's go order! ", i said. The waitress gave us free welcome tapaz. We got 2 small pieces of bread with egg and green chilli. It was nice when we were waiting for our drink to served. Beers then pure glasses of whisky for my hubby and sangrias for me. We enjoyed the moment so much. Talked, laughed and enjoyed the nice musics till made us a little bit hungry hahahahaha XD... We ordered tapaz (shrimp garlic). It served with small pieces of breads. It was so delicious. Nice & kind people will meet the other nice & kind people in the nice place, i believe! I couldn't imagine when the waitress poured the whisky for my husband. "Just say stop when it's enough", she said. My hubby was shocking lol XD. He said stop when it reached double in his glass then he could poure the cold cola plus ice. He ordered again & again till he got drunk hahahahahaha... after nice cold beers then many times had double whisky, he was sooo happy. Me? Liters of sangria off coz.  Pfuhhhh... time to get another food for dinner at another place. We were ready to go. We asked for the bill and prepared to pay around €150... guess what? The bill showed us only €60. I asked her if she sure about it. Because we could pay around €150 in Netherlands for these XD. Go for a good moment here, travelers!

review_preview: I love the nearby michelin star Japanese restaurant, I also love the Argentinean steak house roughly 10 minutes walk from here. The food in Madrid is fantastic and as it stands, Flavia is my number 1.The service is first class, the decor is beautifully...
review_full: I love the nearby michelin star Japanese restaurant, I also love the Argentinean steak house roughly 10 minutes walk from here. The food in Madrid is fantastic and as it stands, Flavia is my number 1. The service is first class, the decor is beautifully done, even the music is magical. The main draw is their food. Homemade pasta, glutton free, dairy free everything an Italian food lover could ask for. The mortadella that's included is an amazing dish itself.  If you are a truffle lover (like me) then you are in for a treat! Freshly shaven truffle on your food and they don't hold back. Amazing pasta, amazing fresh ingredients. Just go to Flavia, you wont regret it. Flavia does Italian food and in my opinion executes it to perfection.

review_preview: This is the best joint on Madrid's famous "tapas street". Don't be put off if it seems crowded; "snug" is the better word. Have a 3 euro glass of cava at the bar while you wait for a table and soak in the happy atmosphere....
review_full: This is the best joint on Madrid's famous "tapas street". Don't be put off if it seems crowded; "snug" is the better word. Have a 3 euro glass of cava at the bar while you wait for a table and soak in the happy atmosphere. A lot of careful thought has gone into La Perejila - "Parsley" in English - right down to the 1920s decor. It's like you're having dinner in the home of a flamboyant grandma. We had the gazpacho, meatball and squid dishes, all great and generously portioned. We won't forget the bearded guy who I assume was the owner. After dinner he brought us a digestif in the form of glasses of orange wine, free of charge, and when I expressed interest in the wine, he left the bottle with us. As we paid he poured us another glass and toasted us.  It was a spur of the moment gesture but it really elevated our last night in Madrid. We left feeling as you should when you leave any restaurant - full, lighthearted and open to the possibilities of the night. Don't walk past La Perejila!

They give u this complementary thin sliced pork and dip, made from mayonnaise, truffles, tuna and anchovies... not that keen on any of that, apart from tuna. BUT, this sauce is aaamazing, mixed with the ham and bread your given, myself and my partner thought we could just eat that all night. Anyway the rest of the meals are amazing, we loved it so much we went back a second night, not sure if there is a better review metric that exists. Pollo Milanese the first night, and the pollo Flavia the second night...chicken, cream sauce, mushrooms, choose the pasta option... music playing was current but good, an Italian with a modern excellent feel and vibe, would recommend this Italian whole heartedly...I will be going back again. And again. Prices are also very reasonable. Awesome - from the both of us! X

title_review: This is a MUST EAT AT!!
review_preview: Flavia	Flavia is an outstanding find in the imminent area of our hotel. It is elegant yet moderately priced. This restaurant was an accidental find when walking around and exploring our first day in the beautiful city of Madrid, Spain. 	The service and hospitality of...
review_full: Flavia  Flavia is an outstanding find in the imminent area of our hotel. It is elegant yet moderately priced. This restaurant was an accidental find when walking around and exploring our first day in the beautiful city of Madrid, Spain.   The service and hospitality of this Italian restaurant was outstanding! (So, good we went back a second time) We first came across this establishment late one night when myself and three other friends were looking for something to eat. We didn’t look the best especially compared to what other people in the restaurant were wearing, but the staff didn’t care about that and took us imminently to a table and explained the big menu they had to offer. This Italian restaurant will take you no matter how you dress. The servers show that they really are for what they do and constantly check in on you and see what you need.  The food here was some of the best Italian I’ve had in a long time, and I am Italian. We were hungry so we ordered 3 appetizers, 4 entrees, and 4 desserts and 4 of the specialty drinks they had that night. All of the food was an experience of its own. Every bite was filled with flavor and creativity. The food made us come back for a second time and would probably be a third time if we had more time in this city.   This is a restaurant that is a MUST EAT AT destination in the corners of back streets. The management and food will wow you and your whole group for sure. I will be back next time I am in Madrid.

review_full: Great food and Sangria. I really enjoyed Squid Ink and the Tomato Salad.  Staff were extremely friendly and accomodating. The owners took over this restaurant in 2017. It felt like a family run restaurant. Do not expect them to open at 8 pm sharp at night. You will be disappointed that they did not allow you to enter at 8 pm sharp. The servers were constantly turning potential customers away due to the small size of the restaurant. Worth the visit if you have reservation.

title_review: Not impressed with the service but very good food!
review_preview: My friends and I had just arrived in Madrid and were starving. Unfortunately, we picked a time where all the restaurants were closing for lunch. We walked around the area where our airbnb was and found El Mollete. I asked if they were still open...
review_full: My friends and I had just arrived in Madrid and were starving. Unfortunately, we picked a time where all the restaurants were closing for lunch. We walked around the area where our airbnb was and found El Mollete. I asked if they were still open and the waitress said they were but we would need to order quickly as the kitchen was closing. I almost wish she'd said they were closed...  When we got to sit down (in this VERY VERY tight corner upstairs), we got the feeling she was rushing us more than necessary.   My friends don't speak Spanish so I had to translate quite a bit and i felt like that was inconvenient for them and as a result found them quite curt and short with us. We inquired if some of the food was coming and their response was unnecessarily rude.  The food we were able to have, however, was really lovely! They asked to go and pay downstairs (which is unusual) but offered us a "chupito" with the bill.  I doubt I'll go there again. There are hundreds of good restaurants with good tapas in Madrid and much better service.

review_preview: We ate here twice and would have visited again but it closes on Sunday and Monday evening.The decor is cheesy with lots of red carnations and a mirrored dining area. The service is really friendly and the food is fresh and delicious.The very...
review_full: We ate here twice and would have visited again but it closes on Sunday and Monday evening. The decor is cheesy with lots of red carnations and a mirrored dining area. The service is really friendly and the food is fresh and delicious. The very simple Iberica ham and tomato tostada is excellent as is the manchego cheese with quince and pine nuts. They are big portions and cost around €6.  We also enjoyed the beef cheeks with plums and mashed potatoes. That was so tasty and the beef soft and tender. This larger dish was €13 and enough to share. House white wine was different both nights both very good and around €15 a bottle. It’s only a tiny place but they try to accommodate as many as they can at the bar as well as at the few tables. Great food and great service full of locals too!

They seem to specialize in small sandwiches lying on a piece of bread, quite typically Spanish. 1 will not be enough, so I recommend choosing at least 2 things on the menu. Atmosphere: it gets really crowded, to the point where you cannot move around. There are very little tables and some people even eat standing up. Personally, I don't enjoy these little Spanish tables, with little portions and a very crowded restaurant.  Staff: they were all over the place so not easy to get their attention.  Price: I paid around 15 euros i think  CONCLUSION: it was ok, nothing special, if anything Ill remember it as the overcrowded place. The food was ok. I wouldn't go back if I'm honest.

title_review: Always busy, with good reason, great atmosphere, great food.
review_preview: I went to this tapas restaurant last night whilst visiting a friend in the city. I've been a couple of times already, and I have to say, that I now feel that a visit to the city is incomplete without at lease one meal here...
review_full: I went to this tapas restaurant last night whilst visiting a friend in the city. I've been a couple of times already, and I have to say, that I now feel that a visit to the city is incomplete without at lease one meal here each time. You need to be prepared to grab a bite at the bar very often as there are very few tables, but if you're prepared to wait for one, it's definitely worth it. The place is decorated like you might expect to find at your grandmothers or even great grandmothers and the music is also of that era. so if that's not for you, don't go. For me, it's all part of the charm. I can't stress enough how busy this place is, so be patient and be rewarded. I've been, I've been back and I'll be back. Keep up the good work Luis, Ana and team.

review_preview: It's Sunday in Madrid. What to do? No doubt. Visit El Rastro (Madrid's Flea Market) and walk the streets of La Latina... until you start craving for some food. It's time to think where to go. Well, you can start with some Vermut & tapas...

You will find the jewels of your grandma in the cabinet of your grandma while sitting in these low stools. I am not sure you can make a reservation, at least we didn't, so go when they open. We did it. We sat. And 10 minutes later, there was a queue and lots of people on the bar waiting for a table. Regarding the food, I loved the Cod in olive oil with paprika from La Vera. Unfortunately, there were not meatballs that day so they suggested the tail of the bull and we ordered it and it was very tender and tasty. Recommended! The atmosphere is fantastic, although when it's crowded can be a bit overwhelming as the restaurant is not very big. I just love this place. A unique experience in La Latina.

title_review: Fabulous food, friendly staff - find this place whilst in Madrid!
review_preview: La Perejila is on the popular Cava Baja, a street full of Tapas Bars/Restaurants. When we arrived there at 20.45 on a Tuesday evening, there appeared to be a crowd of people outside the bar.  I wondered if it had just opened as everyone began...
review_full: La Perejila is on the popular Cava Baja, a street full of Tapas Bars/Restaurants. When we arrived there at 20.45 on a Tuesday evening, there appeared to be a crowd of people outside the bar. I wondered if it had just opened as everyone began piling inside and we got the last available table (lucky us ) We had Surtido de Ibericos (a platter of mixed hams/sausages), the Perejilas (meatballs) and Salmorejo Cordobes (fresh Cordoben style tomato purée, served with ham, hard boiled egg and olive oil). Along with plenty of bread, this was ample between 3 of us. For postre (dessert) we had the daily special, a cheesecake, and a chocolate cake which came with chocolate mousse and has got to be one of the best desserts I have ever had! We washed it all down with some fantastic wine and beer and were given a small glass of orange flavoured fortified wine on the house, which I think you may get if you order a dessert - it was very nice.  I can't remember how much the bill came to. I think it is a little more expensive than some of the other Tapas bars in the area, but it is well worth paying that little extra. The staff are friendly and work very hard, they are really good at looking after everyone's needs. The place itself is so cute and quirky - one of those kind of places that you won't forget in a hurry and will tell other people to visit.  La Perejila was recommended to us by our Spanish apartment host, Marta. It is her favourite Tapas Bar in Madrid and I can see why.  My only problem is, I am writing this review back home in England and I am now wishing I was back in Madrid so I could go and have some more tasty food at La Perejila.

title_review: Traditional tapas bar with great food in Madrid's heart
review_preview: My husband and I, both from Madrid, found this place while walking along the popular street Cava Baja. It caught our attention for the colorful and funky decoration. The place was crowded, but as a table became free just at that moment, we didn't hesitate...
review_full: My husband and I, both from Madrid, found this place while walking along the popular street Cava Baja. It caught our attention for the colorful and funky decoration. The place was crowded, but as a table became free just at that moment, we didn't hesitate and took it. Despite the busy time, the service was really good. The house wine was fantastic. We had three "tostas" (toasted bread with tapas on top) to share and they were all delicious. I was surprised for the quality of the food despite the reasonable price for the area (Madrid most touristic neighborhood). I would definitely come back if I have the chance!

Lots of kitsch but in a good way and thoroughly enjoyed our last night in Madrid thanks to being in here.

They also serve Vermouth on tap and it is the clearest flavour I have ever tasted. The staff are all wonderful and very helpful... this is a must on your visit. Aim to spend a whole evening in this street visiting many of the other great bars... but eat here.

title_review: Excellent Food and Service, Great Value for Money
review_preview: A few steps away from the Prado you can find "Viridiana". Chef owner Abraham Garcia has a reputation for innovation and I was curious about the menu. Interestingly enough, everything I had was off the menu, as it was suggested to me by the waiter...
review_full: A few steps away from the Prado you can find "Viridiana". Chef owner Abraham Garcia has a reputation for innovation and I was curious about the menu. Interestingly enough, everything I had was off the menu, as it was suggested to me by the waiter as "the day's special". I started with a fresh delicious salad with tomatoes of Navarra, goat's cheese, cactus leaves, almonds and anchovies. Simple, honest, ingredients of the highest quality. the main was sashimi with tuna, swordfish and herring. Absolutely delicious. Served with olive oil, and finely chopped onions. Service was excellent, and the bill reasonable, given the quality and the quantity of the dishes.

review_full: We went with great expectations (tipped in 'Where Chefs Eat') but were really disappointed. By far the most expensive meal we had in Madrid and easily the worst. For a city with so many exciting, cutting edge restaurants the food here was really quite old fashioned in a early nineties 'fusion' kind of way. The dishes were incoherent and very hit and miss. Hake with romesco sauce and sweet potato just wasn't very nice. Pork with peach was better (a great piece of meat, nicely cooked), but the deep fried monfkish with apple and pickles was just really poor - basically soggy scampi with a bad tartar sauce. The dish of the night was the fresh fruit for dessert, literally some slices of mango and papaya plus passion fruit, which says it all. There are much better places to eat in Madrid that offer much much better value e.g. the fabulous Triciclo. Sorry to be so negative but just mystified as to how this place has got such a good reputation, perhaps we just caught it on an off night??

review_preview: Tried Taberna Melibea because it made the dinner “must stops” during our month long trip to Madrid. We arrived after lunch so their were no crowds. Staff very welcoming. Drinks were very reasonably priced. My meal, the oxtail with fries was delish. My wife had...
review_full: Tried Taberna Melibea because it made the dinner “must stops” during our month long trip to Madrid. We arrived after lunch so their were no crowds. Staff very welcoming. Drinks were very reasonably priced. My meal, the oxtail with fries was delish. My wife had a steak. Ordered it medium and was more med-well, but overall satisfactory. Tried her steak and it could have used more flavor but that’s me. Also ordered the veggie platter. Overall, too much food for two. No issue, doggie bag requested and the meal was finished the following day. The decor itself is unique and drew us in. No complains at all. Seats are wood so can get uncomfortable if you spend time there. We would return, but have a definite favorite which we frequent 3-4 times a week. Overall satisfied with both food and staff. Recommend for either drinks or a meal.

review_preview: It was rather stuffy inside so we chose one of the few tables outside to enjoy the balmy autumnal evening. Despite being the only ones outside the service was always attentive, efficient, helpful and polite. Kudos.I had high expectations for the food. Maybe too...
review_full: It was rather stuffy inside so we chose one of the few tables outside to enjoy the balmy autumnal evening. Despite being the only ones outside the service was always attentive, efficient, helpful and polite. Kudos. I had high expectations for the food. Maybe too high... The best dishes were the amuse-bouches: the radish&avocado cream was absolutely delicious and the 'jamón' with fig and pickled vegetables was also excellent. Accepting the suggestion of our waiter we shared our starter - herring ('arenque') with mango and avocado. Right choice: it was delicious! Right amount when shared. My partner's main - a sushi'ish dish of salmon, sword-fish and tuna - had too much sauce for our taste and didn't sit right after the raw herring. (We made a bad choice.) My dish, simple grilled pork fillet with prunes and potatoes, was very good but, as I said, maybe my expectations were too high. The suggested wine was perfect for the meal and the dessert - chocolate & coconut can never be bad! - was excellent.

title_review: Class, character and a contemporary attitude!
review_preview: In Madrid, if there's one bar and tapas restaurant, there are easily thousands. So there has to be something special to separate the proverbial men from the boys.In the case of Taberna Melibea, it was the willingness of the server to offer up ideas...
review_full: In Madrid, if there's one bar and tapas restaurant, there are easily thousands. So there has to be something special to separate the proverbial men from the boys. In the case of Taberna Melibea, it was the willingness of the server to offer up ideas to help a beginner not only improve their Spanish but also to add an idiom or two. And, by-the-bye, the tapas were delicious (and considering that many were complimentary, they were also exceptionally generous), the wine was good and the prices were ridiculously cheap . The decor was contemporary punk with a lean towards pro-LGBT political art in the context of traditional azulejos. They certainly made for interesting photo-ops. Recommended, to be sure.

review_preview: Stumbled upon Viridiana as it was a Sunday and most good restaurants are closed. This restaurant was recommended on the elite traveller website as one of the 8 best restaurants in Madrid together with a few Michelin star restaurants that I wanted to book ahead...
review_full: Stumbled upon Viridiana as it was a Sunday and most good restaurants are closed. This restaurant was recommended on the elite traveller website as one of the 8 best restaurants in Madrid together with a few Michelin star restaurants that I wanted to book ahead but were closed on Sundays. It's has also been featured by Conde Nast traveller online.  So I called the restaurant and they happen to have a table for us. Restaurant opens at 8.30pm and was fully packed by the time we left. They have cute ceramic plates in the shape of cowboy hats which I believe the chef likes to wear.  Service was great and they have specials - we were lucky that they received some white truffles from France that day and made an excellent risotto with white truffles. The chef Abraham Gracia will come out and slice the truffles onto your plate. I also tried the cerviche with 3 fresh fish and it was also wonderful. I would give this place a visit as it is a nice place for dinner and the location is not too far away from the Salamanca shopping area. It has 2 tables outdoor, a few on ground level and more tables below underground.

Wine list is very good and service excellent, although we went on a quiet night.

title_review: Must have been an off night
review_preview: Based on the reviews here, the recommendation of the hotel concierge and the Michelin star, I was expecting this meal to be fabulous.  It was very average, so it must have been an off night.it is in a quaint neighborhood near the Prado.  It...
review_full: Based on the reviews here, the recommendation of the hotel concierge and the Michelin star, I was expecting this meal to be fabulous. It was very average, so it must have been an off night. it is in a quaint neighborhood near the Prado. It was safe to walk there, even late at night, and very charming. It is very small and warm inside. Our waiter, Henri, was very charming and knowledgeable. We had a light salad to start which was fine, unremarkable. I had the pork, which was extremely flavorful, although covered in too much sauce for my taste. My companion thought it was incredible. He had the steak, which was very fatty and full of gristle.  For dessert we ordered the mango, which was literally an entire mango, sliced and plated. It was not a terrible meal, but definitely not amazing. For the price, there are better options. All that being said, based on other reviews, it must have been an off night.

title_review: An experience not to be missed
review_preview: When we asked for a taxi at the hotel reception to Viridiana, the receptionist raised her eyebrows and said "Good Restaurant". When visiting this restaurant, remember to take a full wallet and an open mind as the "gratis" course was a little bizarre. The menu...
review_full: When we asked for a taxi at the hotel reception to Viridiana, the receptionist raised her eyebrows and said "Good Restaurant". When visiting this restaurant, remember to take a full wallet and an open mind as the "gratis" course was a little bizarre. The menu is small with several starters and main courses to choose from and it is expensive. Having said that, once you order, you are served with a collection of extra treats. The oddest course was the Strawberry Gazpacho with Pickled Herring. An odd combination which certainly tested our taste buds. The food and wine were magnificent with its famous chef Abraham Garcia taking time to visit every table. This is clearly a popular little bistro and the experience was wonderful. Highly recommend.

review_full: Visited this place twice on our last visit. One our first night in Madrid we were in the mood for low key and good tapas. We lucked out and there was an excellent Spanish music duo playing. What a fun night. The food was very good, the wine very reasonable and very good. The guitars and singing just topped it off. Calls of Ole' and hand clapping, foot stomping accompanied the meal. The best time we had in Madrid on our visit. We came back for dinner another night and had another good meal, wish there had been more music. The prices are excellent, service friendly, local folks and tourists mixed in. I definitely recommend to try this place.

review_preview: Myself and my wife visited for our 30th wedding anniversary. The menu is not for the faint hearted, and I must admit to chickens get out my having a grilled pork main. Such items as a sheeps head and lamb intestines can be found on...
review_full: Myself and my wife visited for our 30th wedding anniversary. The menu is not for the faint hearted, and I must admit to chickens get out my having a grilled pork main. Such items as a sheeps head and lamb intestines can be found on the menu! Do not let this put you off. Firstly we had, not ordered, a gaspacho each severed in small individual pots with lids. Excellent. Again not ordered but with the chefs compliments small picked herrings in a dill sauces. Very tasty and well presented. My wife has a small appetite and therefore was only ever going to order a main, however at the recommendation of the waiter she had some of my pasta with blue cheese sauce and pears. We could not finish this between us. Steak my wife had was very good, but for us she wisely had the sauce on one side. This was chocolate based, and a step too far for us. My pork was very good served with potatoes and prunes. No deserts ordered, but nonetheless we had some speed nibbles, with the restaurants compliments. We shared a bottle of very fine champagne, ( bought as a surprise by our 3 children) and I had a single glass of red with my main. €97 the lot. ,amazing. Great service, theatrical presentation under the chefs trade mark trilby hat covers. A memorable meal

review_preview: My husband and I went to the restaurant the last week of August so it was empty. We were seated at once and promptly served drinks. Chef Garcia came to the table to explain the menu (they have a smaller menu during august) and the...
review_full: My husband and I went to the restaurant the last week of August so it was empty. We were seated at once and promptly served drinks. Chef Garcia came to the table to explain the menu (they have a smaller menu during august) and the daily specials. I was not too hungry so I ordered the hake (merluza) with grilled vegetables and a white garlic sauce and roasted tomato sauce on the side. My husband ordered a salad from the daily special and the hake. I did not pay attention to the description of the salad but the dressing had an asian flare...it was great. The hake.....one of the freshest and best prepared I've had. Before we got the food we ordered we received a complementary starter which included a strawberry gazpacho, chorizo and some fruits and veggies. It was an exceptional meal, one of the finest in Madrid.
